p: Globally, coastal wetlands are among those anticipated to be the most severely impacted by climate change because of increased frequency and intensity of coastal storms, as well as increased flooding and secondary salinization from sea level rise (Albecker & McCoy, 2017). It is too early to determine the full impact that Hurricane Michael may have had on freshwater wetlands and their associated biodiversity at St. Marks National Wildlife Refuge. Our detection of live individuals of several species and, especially, of A. cingulatum following saltwater inundation of breeding habitat is encouraging in the short‐term, but we remain cautious in our expectations for long‐term resiliency of this vital population.
